challenges.name: Intro section with dropdown navigation
challenges.description: This challenge will test your ability to create dropdown navigation menus, a common pattern on larger sites. It will also provide some nice basic layout challenges.

challenges.name: In-browser markdown editor
challenges.description: In this project, you'll build a fully-functional in-browser markdown editor application with a light/dark mode toggle. It's also perfect to build as a full-stack app!

challenges.name: Interactive rating component
challenges.description: This is a nice, small project to practice handling user interactions and updating the DOM. Perfect for anyone who has learned the basics of JavaScript!

challenges.name: Entertainment web app
challenges.description: This multi-page entertainment web app will have you working with json data, routing, state management, and search functionality.

challenges.name: Advice generator app
challenges.description: The perfect project if you're learning how to interact with 3rd-party APIs. This challenge uses the Advice Slip API to generate random quotes of advice.

challenges.name: Suite landing page
challenges.description: This small-ish html and css only landing page includes some interesting layout decisions. perfect if you want to put your layout and responsive skills to the test!

challenges.name: QR code component
challenges.description: A perfect first challenge if you're new to HTML and CSS. The card layout doesn't shift, so it's ideal if you haven't learned about building responsive layouts yet.

challenges.name: Tic Tac Toe game
challenges.description: This classic practice project for web developers is a great exercise to complete. It will test your HTML semantics, your grid layout skill, as well as your JS logic.

challenges.name: Interactive comments section
challenges.description: This is project will put your JavaScript skills to the test. We provide a JSON file to pull the data, but it's also a perfect project to build as a full-stack CRUD app!

challenges.name: Art Gallery website
challenges.description: This two-page art gallery project will be perfect if you're ready to branch out beyond single landing pages. There are some particularly interesting layout challenges!

challenges.name: NFT preview card component
challenges.description: This HTML & CSS only challenge is perfect for anyone just starting out or anyone wanting a small project to play around with.

challenges.name: Equalizer landing page
challenges.description: This challenge will be a perfect test of your HTML & CSS skills. If you're starting to get comfortable building smaller projects, this will be a great step up.

challenges.name: Space tourism multi-page website
challenges.description: This project is a fun collaboration with Scrimba and Kevin Powell! If you like, you can follow along and watch Kevin complete the project on Scrimba. Lots to learn!

challenges.name: E-commerce product page
challenges.description: In this challenge, you'll build a beautiful product page. We'll be putting your JS skills to the test with a lightbox product gallery and cart functionality!

challenges.name: Memory game
challenges.description: This project will be an excellent test for your HTML, CSS, and JS skills! You'll be building a fun memory game where players try to match pairs.

challenges.name: Time tracking dashboard
challenges.description: A perfect opportunity to practice your CSS Grid skills. For anyone wanting to take it up a notch, we provide a JSON data file to practice working with data.

challenges.name: Github user search app
challenges.description: In this project, you'll use the GitHub users API to pull profile data and display it. It's a great challenge if you're looking to practice working with a 3rd-party API.

challenges.name: Order summary component
challenges.description: A perfect project for newbies who are starting to build confidence with layouts!

challenges.name: Galleria sideshow site
challenges.description: This art gallery slideshow project will be a great test for your layout and JS skills. With the masonry layout, slideshow logic, and lightbox view there's a lot to build!

challenges.name: Tip calculator app
challenges.description: This small app is perfect for anyone starting to get to grips with JavaScript. The calculator functionality will be a nice test!

bookmarks.title: Responsive Feedback app using Angular 12 with springboot for services
bookmarks.questions: This is the first time I make something with html & css after learning it for 2 days, so it's not perfect hahaha. I had trouble with aligning vertically the white box that contains the image and the text (tried using flexbox and other methods, neither of them worked without a specific height so I had to specify it and because of that it's not responsive, not sure of how to do it correctly :( ) All feedback is welcome, thank you!
